formattedAddress: 132 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 132 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016-0914, USA

editorialSummary.text: Refined Italian menu with a focus on dishes from Northern & Southern Italy, served in cozy environs.

originalText.text: This place is in the residential block that you would not expect the restaurant be here. Yet it seems it has been here for ages. The space and the food feels traditional. The dishes we had is great. Bronzino is cooked perfectly. Cozy! Quiet! Pleasant!

text.text: This place is in the residential block that you would not expect the restaurant be here. Yet it seems it has been here for ages. The space and the food feels traditional. The dishes we had is great. Bronzino is cooked perfectly. Cozy! Quiet! Pleasant!

originalText.text: A cozy gem!  We were lucky to get a last minute table due to bad weather.  We were greeted warmly by the owner, and our waiter was kind enough to make a special plate when one of us couldn’t decide on what to get.  Everyone enjoyed their delicious meals.  I was hoping to show off NY red sauce Italian to out of state guests, and this place did the trick.   Cannot recommend it enough!

text.text: A cozy gem!  We were lucky to get a last minute table due to bad weather.  We were greeted warmly by the owner, and our waiter was kind enough to make a special plate when one of us couldn’t decide on what to get.  Everyone enjoyed their delicious meals.  I was hoping to show off NY red sauce Italian to out of state guests, and this place did the trick.   Cannot recommend it enough!

originalText.text: A great neighborhood, traditional Italian restaurant. The food is delicious. The calamari in red sauce was delicious, perfectly cooked, seasoned and complex. I had the veal marsala with linguini which I also thought was perfect. The meat was tenderized, subtly coated and bursting with that delicious marsala sauce. The portions are large so definitely expect to take leftovers home. Their homemade, traditional cheesecake was the perfect way to finish the night.

text.text: A great neighborhood, traditional Italian restaurant. The food is delicious. The calamari in red sauce was delicious, perfectly cooked, seasoned and complex. I had the veal marsala with linguini which I also thought was perfect. The meat was tenderized, subtly coated and bursting with that delicious marsala sauce. The portions are large so definitely expect to take leftovers home. Their homemade, traditional cheesecake was the perfect way to finish the night.

originalText.text: Cozy, friendly, a place that feels like and tastes like family. Very quick and attentive service, immediately made me feel like home. The food was tasty and comforting - fantastic calamari. My only “complaint” was that the food felt a bit too much on the salty side for my taste - but it didn’t take away from the flavor at all. Makes for great leftovers too!

text.text: Cozy, friendly, a place that feels like and tastes like family. Very quick and attentive service, immediately made me feel like home. The food was tasty and comforting - fantastic calamari. My only “complaint” was that the food felt a bit too much on the salty side for my taste - but it didn’t take away from the flavor at all. Makes for great leftovers too!

originalText.text:
Wow! So happy to start my New Year dining experience at such a great establishment. All around a fantastic experience.

I made a reservation on Google Assistant and they prepared a four seat table for us. The seating was comfortable. The napkin art was a nice touch. We couldn’t be under the tent but they moved two heaters near our table to accommodate so we weren’t cold. They treated us very nicely.

The bread for the table was fresh and crunchy. We started with the calamari which had a fantastic sauce - more on the sauces later. I ordered the special clam stuffed with crab meat and shrimp. It was the large size because the small comes with two. It was toasted to perfection on top and I could see the real lumps of shrimp and crab! The clams sat on top of a LOVELY lemon sauce that put the dish on top. All of the people at the table live together and tried each other’s dishes. The mussels were tender. The risotto wasn’t overpowered with too much pesto. And the chicken portobello sauce was tangy and rich. Every plate was delicious and you wouldn’t go wrong getting any of these. We also drank some nice wines and finished with the ricotta cheesecake and cappuccinos.

I can’t wait to visit again for the cute indoor dining one day.
